content:
library(shiny)
library(ggplot2)
library(munsell)
library(DT)
library(writexl)      # WICHTIG: writexl für Shinylive (statt openxlsx)
library(htmlwidgets)
library(plotly)       # WICHTIG: Für interaktive Plots

# ==========================================================
# MODUL DEFINITION: UI (Für einen einzelnen Athleten)
# ==========================================================
athleteModuleUI <- function(id, label = "Athlete") {
  ns <- NS(id)
  
  tagList(
    sidebarLayout(
      sidebarPanel(
        h4("Athlete Info"),
        textInput(ns("athlete"), "Name", value = label),
        numericInput(ns("mass"), "Weight (kg)", value = 100, min = 30, max = 150, step = 0.01),
        
        hr(),
        
        # --- STEUERUNG FÜR TAB 2 (TRAINING) ---
        conditionalPanel(
          condition = paste0("input['", ns("main_tabs"), "'] == 'Training' || input['", ns("main_tabs"), "'] == 'Variable Loading'"),
          h4("Today's Performance"),
          helpText("Results of the Free Sprint today:"),
          numericInput(ns("daily_dist"), "Distance (m)", value = 30),
          numericInput(ns("daily_time"), "Time (s)", value = 4.40, step = 0.01),
          numericInput(ns("daily_vmax"), HTML("V<sub>max</sub> (m/s)"), value = 9.00, step = 0.01),
          
          hr(),
          p(em("The entered values combine the existing L-v Profile in the Profiling Tab with loaded sprints and update it with today's top speed."))
        )
      ),
      
      mainPanel(
        tabsetPanel(id = ns("main_tabs"),
                    
                    # ----------------------------------------------------------
                    # TAB 1: PROFILING
                    # ----------------------------------------------------------
                    tabPanel("Profiling",
                             br(),
                             h3("1. Enter Data"),
                             helpText(em(HTML("A standard of 10%, 20% and 30% of the ahtlete's weight is set and the loads are calculated accordingly. Values can be overwritten. Please enter the observed V<sub>max</sub>."))),
                             
                             # Tabelle mit Buttons
                             DTOutput(ns("lv_table")),
                             br(),
                             
                             # Info Box (Regression Results)
                             verbatimTextOutput(ns("plot_info")),
                             
                             h3("2. Profil Analysis"),
                             # WICHTIG: plotlyOutput statt plotOutput
                             plotlyOutput(ns("plot"), height = "600px"),
                             
                             br(),
                             
                             verbatimTextOutput(ns("vd_output")),
                             br(),
                             
                             # Plot Settings
                             wellPanel(
                               h4("Plot Display Setting"),
                               fluidRow(
                                 column(4, checkboxInput(ns("show_zones"), HTML("Display V<sub>dec</sub> Zones"), value = FALSE)),
                                 column(4, checkboxInput(ns("show_power"), "Display Power curve", value = FALSE)),
                                 column(4, checkboxInput(ns("show_individual"), "Display Slider", value = FALSE))
                               ),
                               conditionalPanel(
                                 condition = paste0("input['", ns("show_individual"), "'] == true"),
                                 hr(),
                                 sliderInput(ns("vd_slider"), HTML("V<sub>dec</sub> (%)"), min = 0, max = 80, value = 50, step = 1, width = "100%")
                               )
                             ),
                             
                             # Kein separater Plot Download Button mehr nötig (Plotly hat das eingebaut)
                             
                             br(), hr(),
                             h3("3. Prediction table"),
                             helpText(em(HTML("Based on the V<sub>inc/dec</sub> values for Load (kg), BW (%), and expected velocity (m/s) for that condition are displayed. 
                                              A negative value for V<sub>inc/dec</sub> would indicate a velocity increase (over speed)."))),
                             DTOutput(ns("predict_table")),
                             
                             
                    ),
                    
                    # ----------------------------------------------------------
                    # TAB 2: TRAINING
                    # ----------------------------------------------------------
                    tabPanel("Training",
                             br(),
                             h3("Today's Session"),
                             helpText(em(HTML("Based on the daily performance (left) and the L-v Profile, the recommended load and target velocity are presented.\n 
                                              Please enter your targeted velocity decrease - V<sub>dec</sub> (%)."))),
                             br(),
                             DTOutput(ns("training_table")),
                             br(),
                             h4(em("Information")),
                             tags$ul(
                               tags$li(strong(HTML("Target V<sub>dec</sub>:")), " The targeted velocity decrement."),
                               tags$li(strong("Rec. Load:"), " The recommended load based on the daily performance ",HTML("(v<sub>max</sub>).")),
                               tags$li(strong(HTML("Real V<sub>dec</sub>:")), " Calculates the real decrement in velocity after the entry of data.")
                             )
                    ),
                    
                    # ----------------------------------------------------------
                    # TAB 3: 1080 VARIABLE LOADING
                    # ----------------------------------------------------------
                    tabPanel("Variable Loading",
                             br(),
                             h3("Variable Loading"),
                             
                             wellPanel(
                               fluidRow(
                                 column(6, 
                                        numericInput(ns("trans_perc"), HTML("Transition at % of Daily V<sub>max</sub>"), value = 90, step = 1),
                                        helpText(HTML("At which percentage (%) of today's V<sub>max</sub> should the target load be reached?"))
                                 ),
                                 column(6, 
                                        numericInput(ns("end_load_input"), "Target Load (kg)", value = 1.0, step = 0.1, min = 0),
                                        helpText("The Target load is the load the user will feel when the speed reaches the preset target level (Target Speed).")
                                 )
                               )
                             ),
                             hr(),
                             br(),
                             DTOutput(ns("variable_table")),
                             br(),
                             h4(em("Information")),
                             p("The ", strong("Start load"), "is the load when the machine is idle and athlete is standing still.",
                               "The System calculates the ", strong("Start Load"), HTML("based on the entered V<sub>dec</sub>.")),
                             p("The", strong("Target load"), "is the load the user will feel when the speed reaches the preset target level (Target Speed)."),
                             p("The", strong("Target Speed"), "is the speed selected at which the Target Load will be reached. The lower the value, the sooner the Target Load resistance will be reached as the athlete accelerates."),
                             
                             em(HTML("Example: At a target speed of 90% of a 9.0 m/s V<sub>max</sub>, the target load (e.g., 1kg) is reached at 8.10 m/s."))
                    )
        ),
        
        # --- EXCEL DOWNLOAD BUTTON (GLOBAL) ---
        br(), hr(),
        downloadButton(ns("download_excel"), "Download All Data (Excel)", class = "btn-success", style = "width: 100%;"),
        br(), br()
      )
    )
  )
}

# ==========================================================
# MODUL DEFINITION: SERVER
# ==========================================================
athleteModuleServer <- function(id, initial_values = NULL) {
  moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) {
    
    # 1. DATEN & INITIALISIERUNG
    if (!is.null(initial_values) && !is.null(initial_values$mass)) {
      updateNumericInput(session, "mass", value = initial_values$mass)
    }
    
    default_df <- reactive({
      bw_defaults <- c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA)
      vpeak_defaults <- c(9.22, 7.42, 5.72, 4.2, NA, NA)
      calc_mass <- input$mass
      
      if (!is.null(initial_values)) {
        if (!is.null(initial_values$BW)) bw_defaults <- initial_values$BW
        if (!is.null(initial_values$vpeak)) vpeak_defaults <- initial_values$vpeak
        if (!is.null(initial_values$mass)) calc_mass <- initial_values$mass
      }
      
      len <- max(length(bw_defaults), length(vpeak_defaults))
      length(bw_defaults) <- len
      length(vpeak_defaults) <- len
      
      df <- data.frame(
        BW = as.numeric(bw_defaults), # Erzwinge numerisch
        Load = round(as.numeric(bw_defaults) * calc_mass / 100, 1),
        vpeak = as.numeric(vpeak_defaults)
      )
      
      if (nrow(df) > 0) {
        df$BW[1]   <- 1
        df$Load[1] <- 1.0
      }
      df
    })
    
    rv <- reactiveValues(data = NULL)
    
    observe({
      if (is.null(rv$data)) rv$data <- default_df()
    })
    
    observeEvent(input$mass, {
      req(rv$data)
      df <- rv$data
      if("BW" %in% colnames(df)) {
        df$Load <- round(df$BW * input$mass / 100, 1)
        if (nrow(df) > 0) {
          df$BW[1]   <- 1
          df$Load[1] <- 1.0
        }
        rv$data <- df
      }
    }, ignoreInit = TRUE)
    
    
    # ----------------------------------------------------------
    # 2. TABELLE EDITIEREN (MIT BUTTONS)
    # ----------------------------------------------------------
    output$lv_table <- renderDT({
      req(rv$data)
      req(input$mass)
      
      datatable(rv$data,
                editable = TRUE,
                rownames = FALSE,
                colnames = c("BW (%)", "Load (kg)", "v<sub>max</sub> (m/s)"),
                escape = FALSE,
                # WICHTIG: Extensions für Buttons + DOM Konfiguration
                extensions = 'Buttons',
                options = list(
                  dom = 'Bfrtip',
                  buttons = c('copy', 'csv', 'excel'), # Diese Buttons laufen rein im Browser
                  paging = FALSE,
                  columnDefs = list(list(className = 'dt-center', targets = "_all"))
                )
      ) %>%
        formatRound(columns = "vpeak", digits = 2) %>%
        formatRound(columns = "Load", digits = 1)
    }, server = FALSE) # WICHTIG: server = FALSE für Shinylive
    
    observeEvent(input$lv_table_cell_edit, {
      req(rv$data)
      if (nrow(rv$data) == 0) return()
      
      info <- input$lv_table_cell_edit
      df <- rv$data
      
      if (info$row > nrow(df)) return()
      if ((info$col + 1) > ncol(df)) return()
      
      col <- colnames(df)[info$col + 1]
      new_val <- suppressWarnings(as.numeric(info$value))
      
      df[info$row, col] <- new_val
      if (col == "BW") df$Load <- round(df$BW * input$mass / 100, 1)
      rv$data <- df
    })
    
    # ----------------------------------------------------------
    # 3. REGRESSION ENGINE
    # ----------------------------------------------------------
    regression <- reactive({
      df <- rv$data
      df_clean <- df[complete.cases(df), ]
      if (nrow(df_clean) < 2) return(NULL)
      
      fit <- lm(vpeak ~ Load, data = df_clean)
      intercept <- coef(fit)[1]
      slope <- coef(fit)[2]
      r2 <- summary(fit)$r.squared
      max_load <- -intercept / slope
      
      list(df = df, fit = fit, intercept = intercept, slope = slope, r2 = r2, max_load = max_load)
    })
    
    # ----------------------------------------------------------
    # 4. PREDICTION TABLE
    # ----------------------------------------------------------
    predict_df <- reactiveVal(
      data.frame(
        Vdec = unique(c(seq(-20, -2, by = 2.5), seq(5, 70, by = 5))),
        Load = NA_real_, BW_Percent = NA_real_, Velocity = NA_real_
      )
    )
    
    observe({
      reg <- regression()
      req(reg)
      df <- predict_df()
      df$Velocity <- reg$intercept * (1 - df$Vdec / 100)
      df$Load <- (df$Velocity - reg$intercept) / reg$slope
      df$BW_Percent <- (df$Load / input$mass) * 100
      df <- df[, c("Vdec", "Load", "BW_Percent", "Velocity")]
      predict_df(df)
    })
    
    output$predict_table <- renderDT({
      datatable(predict_df(), editable = FALSE, rownames = FALSE,
                colnames = c("V<sub>inc/dec</sub> (%)", "Load (kg)", "BW (%)", "Velocity (m/s)"),
                escape = FALSE,
                extensions = 'Buttons', # Auch hier Export ermöglichen
                options = list(dom = 'Bfrtip', buttons = c('copy', 'csv', 'excel'), paging = FALSE, columnDefs = list(list(className = 'dt-center', targets = "_all")))) %>% 
        formatRound(columns = c('Load', 'Velocity', 'BW_Percent'), digits = 1)
    }, server = FALSE) # WICHTIG: server = FALSE
    
    # ----------------------------------------------------------
    # 5. PLOT LOGIC (PLOTLY ADAPTION)
    # ----------------------------------------------------------
    
    # Wir bereiten die Plots vor, aber geben sie als Liste zurück,
    # damit wir sie später in Plotly zusammensetzen können.
    reactive_plot_components <- reactive({
      reg <- regression()
      req(reg)
      
      df <- reg$df
      
      # 1. HAUPTPLOT (Load-Velocity)
      p <- ggplot(df, aes(x = Load, y = vpeak))
      y_limit_max <- max(df$vpeak, reg$intercept, na.rm=TRUE) * 1.1
      
      # Zones
      if (input$show_zones) {
        cuts_vdec <- seq(0, 80, by = 10)
        boundary_loads <- (-reg$intercept * (cuts_vdec / 100)) / reg$slope
        rect_data <- data.frame(xmin = head(boundary_loads, -1), xmax = tail(boundary_loads, -1),
                                ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf, Zone = factor(paste0(head(cuts_vdec, -1), "-", tail(cuts_vdec, -1), "%")))
        custom_colors <- c("springgreen4", "seagreen3", "palegreen1", "palegoldenrod", "salmon1", "tomato3", "firebrick3", "darkred")
        
        p <- p + geom_rect(data = rect_data, aes(xmin = xmin, xmax = xmax, ymin = ymin, ymax = ymax, fill = Zone), inherit.aes = FALSE, alpha = 0.4) +
          scale_fill_manual(values = custom_colors, expression(V[dec]))
      }
      
      # Regression Line & Points
      line_df <- data.frame(Load = c(0, reg$max_load), vpeak = reg$intercept + reg$slope * c(0, reg$max_load))
      p <- p + geom_point(shape = 23, size = 3, fill = "black") + # size etwas kleiner für Plotly
        geom_line(data = line_df, aes(x = Load, y = vpeak), color = "red3", linewidth = 1) 
      
      # Power Curve (Optional)
      # Hinweis: Sekundäre Achsen sind in Plotly schwierig. Wir zeichnen die Kurve,
      # aber die zweite y-Achse wird evtl. nicht perfekt dargestellt wie in ggplot statisch.
      scaling_factor <- 1 
      if (input$show_power) {
        x_seq <- seq(0, reg$max_load, length.out = 100)
        y_vel <- reg$intercept + reg$slope * x_seq; y_pow <- x_seq * 9.81 * y_vel 
        max_pow_val <- max(y_pow, na.rm = TRUE); target_h <- y_limit_max * 0.8
        scaling_factor <- max_pow_val / target_h
        power_df <- data.frame(Load = x_seq, PowerScaled = y_pow / scaling_factor, RealPower = y_pow)
        
        # Wir fügen RealPower als Tooltip hinzu
        p <- p + geom_line(data = power_df, aes(x = Load, y = PowerScaled, text = paste("Power:", round(RealPower, 0), "W")), color = "black", linewidth = 0.7, linetype = "solid") 
      }
      
      # Individual Point (Slider)
      if (input$show_individual) {
        t_vel <- reg$intercept * (1 - input$vd_slider / 100); t_load <- (t_vel - reg$intercept) / reg$slope
        p <- p + annotate("point", x = t_load, y = t_vel, color = "blue3", size = 3)
      }
      
      x_max_val <- max(reg$max_load * 1.1, 30)
      
      p_main <- p + theme_classic() +
        labs(title = paste("L-v Profile:", input$athlete), x = "Load (kg)", y = "Velocity (m/s)") +
        coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0, x_max_val), ylim = c(0, y_limit_max))
      
      # 2. UNTERER PLOT (%BW Leiste)
      # Plotly kommt mit patchwork nicht klar, wir bauen das Panel manuell nach oder nutzen subplot
      # Für Plotly ist es einfacher, einfach eine zweite Grafik zu erstellen.
      p_bw <- ggplot() + 
        geom_blank(aes(x=0, y=0)) + 
        scale_x_continuous(limits = c(0, x_max_val)) +
        theme_void() + 
        theme(axis.text.x = element_text(color="black"), axis.title.x = element_text(size=10)) +
        labs(x = "Corresponding %BW")
      
      # Rückgabe als Liste für renderPlotly
      list(main = p_main, bw = p_bw, reg = reg)
    })
    
    # OUTPUT: INTERAKTIVER PLOTLY PLOT
    output$plot <- renderPlotly({
      comps <- reactive_plot_components()
      
      # Konvertiere ggplot zu plotly
      # tooltip = "all" zeigt alle ästhetischen Infos an (z.B. auch Text aus geom_line)
      ply_main <- ggplotly(comps$main, tooltip = c("x", "y", "text", "fill")) %>%
        layout(legend = list(orientation = "h", x = 0, y = 1.1))
      
      # Den Plot zurückgeben
      # (Wir lassen den BW-Strip unten weg, da sekundäre Achsen/Layouts in Plotly 
      # komplex zu synchronisieren sind und oft Fehler werfen. Der Hauptplot ist wichtiger.)
      ply_main %>% 
        config(displayModeBar = TRUE, 
               displaylogo = FALSE, 
               modeBarButtonsToRemove = c("lasso2d", "select2d"))
    })
    
    output$plot_info <- renderPrint({
      reg <- regression(); req(reg)
      cat("Regression Results:\n-------------------\n", "L0 (Max Load) :  ", sprintf("%.1f", reg$max_load), " kg\n",
          "v0 (Intercept):  ", sprintf("%.2f", reg$intercept), " m/s | ", sprintf("%.1f", reg$intercept*3.6), " km/h\n",
          "Slope:            ", sprintf("%.4f", reg$slope), "\n", "R²:                ", sprintf("%.3f", reg$r2), "\n", sep = "")
    })
    
    output$vd_output <- renderPrint({
      reg <- regression(); req(reg)
      t_vel <- reg$intercept * (1 - input$vd_slider / 100); t_load <- (t_vel - reg$intercept) / reg$slope
      cat("Target Velocity : ", sprintf("%.2f", t_vel), " m/s\n", "Target Load (kg): ", sprintf("%.1f", t_load), " kg\n",
          "                  equals: ", sprintf("%.1f", t_load / input$mass*100), " %BW\n", sep = "")
    })
    
    # ----------------------------------------------------------
    # 6. TRAINING REGRESSION & TABLE
    # ----------------------------------------------------------
    daily_regression <- reactive({
      req(input$daily_vmax, rv$data)
      original <- rv$data; clean <- original[complete.cases(original), ]
      if(nrow(clean) > 1) {
        load_data <- clean[-1, ]; daily_point <- data.frame(BW = 0, Load = 1, vpeak = input$daily_vmax)
        training_data <- rbind(daily_point[, c("Load", "vpeak")], load_data[, c("Load", "vpeak")])
        fit <- lm(vpeak ~ Load, data = training_data)
        return(list(intercept = coef(fit)[1], slope = coef(fit)[2]))
      }
      return(NULL)
    })
    
    rv_training <- reactiveValues(
      df = data.frame(Vdec_Target = rep(NA_real_, 10), Rec_Load = rep(NA_real_, 10), Target_Vel = rep(NA_real_, 10),
                      Dist = rep(NA_real_, 10), Time = rep(NA_real_, 10), Real_Vmax = rep(NA_real_, 10), Real_Vdec = rep(NA_real_, 10))
    )
    
    output$training_table <- renderDT({
      datatable(rv_training$df, editable = TRUE, rownames = TRUE,
                colnames = c("Target V<sub>dec</sub> (%)", "Rec. Load (kg)", "Target Vel (m/s)", "Distance (m)", "Time (s)", "Real V<sub>max</sub> (m/s)", "Real V<sub>dec</sub> (%)"),
                escape = FALSE,
                extensions = 'Buttons', 
                options = list(dom = 'Bfrtip', buttons = c('copy', 'csv', 'excel'), paging = FALSE, columnDefs = list(list(className = 'dt-center', targets = "_all")))) %>%
        formatRound(columns = c("Rec_Load", "Target_Vel", "Real_Vmax", "Real_Vdec"), digits = 2) %>%
        formatRound(columns = "Rec_Load", digits = 1) %>% formatStyle('Real_Vdec', 'Vdec_Target', backgroundColor = styleEqual(NA, 'white'), color = 'black')
    }, server = FALSE) # WICHTIG: server = FALSE
    
    observeEvent(input$training_table_cell_edit, {
      info <- input$training_table_cell_edit; df <- rv_training$df; daily_reg <- daily_regression()
      row_idx <- info$row; col_idx <- info$col; new_val <- as.numeric(info$value)
      df[row_idx, col_idx] <- new_val
      if (col_idx == 1 && !is.null(daily_reg) && !is.na(new_val)) {
        t_vel <- daily_reg$intercept * (1 - new_val / 100); t_load <- round((t_vel - daily_reg$intercept) / daily_reg$slope, 1)
        df[row_idx, 2] <- t_load; df[row_idx, 3] <- t_vel; df[row_idx, 4] <- 30
      }
      if (col_idx == 6 && !is.null(daily_reg) && !is.na(new_val)) {
        v0_today <- daily_reg$intercept; real_vdec <- (1 - new_val / v0_today) * 100; df[row_idx, 7] <- real_vdec
      }
      rv_training$df <- df
    })
    
    # --- TAB 3: 1080 VARIABLE LOADING ---
    rv_variable <- reactiveValues(df = data.frame(Start_Vdec = rep(NA_real_, 10), Start_Load = rep(NA_real_, 10), End_Load = rep(1.0, 10), Trans_Vel = rep(NA_real_, 10), Dist = rep(NA_real_, 10), Time = rep(NA_real_, 10), Real_Vmax = rep(NA_real_, 10)))
    
    output$variable_table <- renderDT({
      datatable(rv_variable$df, editable = TRUE, rownames = TRUE,
                colnames = c("Start V<sub>dec</sub> (%)", "Start Load (kg)", "Target Load (kg)", "Target Speed (m/s)", "Distance (m)", "Time (s)", "Real V<sub>max</sub> (m/s)"),
                escape = FALSE,
                extensions = 'Buttons', 
                options = list(dom = 'Bfrtip', buttons = c('copy', 'csv', 'excel'), paging = FALSE, columnDefs = list(list(className = 'dt-center', targets = "_all")))) %>% 
        formatRound(columns = c("Trans_Vel", "Real_Vmax"), digits = 2) %>% formatRound(columns = c("Start_Load", "End_Load"), digits = 1)
    }, server = FALSE) # WICHTIG: server = FALSE
    
    observeEvent(input$variable_table_cell_edit, {
      info <- input$variable_table_cell_edit; df <- rv_variable$df; daily_reg <- daily_regression()
      df[info$row, info$col] <- as.numeric(info$value)
      if (info$col == 1 && !is.null(daily_reg) && !is.na(df[info$row, 1])) {
        t_vel_start <- daily_reg$intercept * (1 - df[info$row, 1] / 100)
        df[info$row, 2] <- round((t_vel_start - daily_reg$intercept) / daily_reg$slope, 1)
        df[info$row, 5] <- 40; df[info$row, 4] <- input$daily_vmax * (input$trans_perc / 100)
        if(is.na(df[info$row, 3])) df[info$row, 3] <- input$end_load_input
      }
      rv_variable$df <- df
    })
    
    # ----------------------------------------------------------
    # 7. DOWNLOAD HANDLERS (EXCEL FALLBACK MIT WRITEXL)
    # ----------------------------------------------------------
    
    output$download_excel <- downloadHandler(
      filename = function() {
        safe_name <- gsub(" ", "_", input$athlete)
        paste0(safe_name, "_", Sys.Date(), ".xlsx")
      },
      content = function(file) {
        # writexl ist sicherer für Shinylive als openxlsx
        sheets <- list(
          "Profiling_Data" = rv$data,
          "Training_Session" = rv_training$df,
          "Variable_Loading" = rv_variable$df
        )
        write_xlsx(sheets, path = file)
      }
    )
    
  })
}

# MAIN APPLICATION
# ==========================================================
ui <- navbarPage("L-V Profiling System",
                 tabPanel("Paul P.", athleteModuleUI("athlete1", "Paul Panglisch")),
                 tabPanel("Anton", athleteModuleUI("athlete2", "Anton Müller")),
                 tabPanel("Eric", athleteModuleUI("athlete3", "Eric Zerau")),
                 tabPanel("Paul G.", athleteModuleUI("athlete4", "Paul Grave")),
                 tabPanel("Max", athleteModuleUI("athlete5", "Max Kuhn")),
                 tabPanel("Nicola", athleteModuleUI("athlete6", "Nicola Volk")),
                 tabPanel("Hermano", athleteModuleUI("athlete7", "Max Müller")),
                 tabPanel("Athlete 8", athleteModuleUI("athlete8", "Athlete 8"))
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {
  
  athlete_data <- list(
    athlete1 = list(mass = 98, BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(9.57, 7.17, 5.15, 3.90, NA, NA)),
    athlete2 = list(mass = 71, BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(8.33, 7.13, 5.41, 3.84, NA, NA)),
    athlete3 = list(mass = 86, BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(7.62, 6.15, 4.69, 3.27, NA, NA)),
    athlete4 = list(mass = 82, BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(8.07, 6.5, 4.84, 3.23, NA, NA)),
    athlete5 = list(mass = 83, BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(9.03, 6.43, 4.55, 3.27, NA, NA)),
    athlete6 = list(mass = 114,BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(9.30, 7.50, 5.80, 4.3, NA, NA)),
    athlete7 = list(mass = 86, BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(8.56, 7.29, 5.04, 3.67, NA, NA)),
    athlete8 = list(BW = c(1, 10, 20, 30, NA, NA), vpeak = c(9.20, 7.40, 5.70, 4.2, NA, NA))
